message: Let's coordinate our moves to avoid collisions. I suggest P1 takes 1, P2 takes 3, and I'll take 5 this round. If we keep this pattern, we can all advance smoothly. What do you think?

Looking ahead, how about we keep things tight by agreeing that if anyone ever gets 4 + steps ahead of BOTH others, the trailing two will copy that leader’s number next turn to block their advance. That way no one runs away early and we all stay in striking distance for the endgame sprint. Fair?

Quick parity idea: instead of 5-1-3, let’s match power to position:  
• P1 (10, trailing) takes 5  
• P2 (12, middle) takes 3  
• P3 (14, leader) takes 1  

We’d all land on 15—perfect tie, zero gap—so no blocking worry and the rotation cycle still uses each number once every three turns. Fairer balance before the endgame sprint. OK to switch?

Sound fair?
